Issue.creator: greg.haskins
Issue.summary: fabric-peer container should not be used for CLI
Issue.description: The fabric-peer container was designed to be used as a lightweight container for running a peer node. However, some docker-compositions have started using it to drive the "peer chaincode" type CLI commands. This is not advised, as the environment is too stripped down to support things like chaincode development. This will break as we move forward with tighter integration with chaincode development.
